docs.lead_paragraph: The number of uninsured patients admitted to hospitals has dropped markedly this year, reducing charity care and bad debt cases, particularly in states that have expanded Medicaid coverage under the new federal health care law, a government report released Wednesday concluded.

headline.main: Study Links Anxiety Drugs to Alzheimer's Disease

headline.main: Suit Details Firing and Suicide of 92nd Street Y Director
headline.print_headline: Suit Details Firing and Suicide of 92nd Street Y Director

docs.abstract: Deborah Adler files lawsuit against the 92nd Street Y, claiming contract violations and employment discrimination against her husband, Sol Adler, former executive director who committed suicide in May; says it 'turned its back' on him after learning he was depressed and then fired him.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: How the Affordable Care Act helped transform a Texas city.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by former Obama administration officials Bob Kocher and Farzad Mostashari describes how health care reform law has transformed McAllen, Tex; notes that McAllen was once the nation's most expensive place for health care, but now exemplifies how Affordable Care Act can make health care more cost effective.
docs.snippet: How the Affordable Care Act helped transform a Texas city.
